member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager
member.summary: Manages all for a service replica. Each replica in a service has its own state manager and thus its own set of .

member.summary: Reliable State Manager Replica implementation.

member.summary: Create a new ReliableStateManager
member.param: A that describes the service context.
Configuration parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.GetAsyncEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: An object that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.BackupAsync(System.Func{Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.BackupInfo,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Performs a full backup of all reliable state managed by this .
member.param: Callback to be called when the backup folder has been created locally and is ready to be moved out of the node.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous backup operation.
member.remarks: A FULL backup will be performed with a one-hour timeout. Boolean returned by the backupCallback indicate whether the service was able to successfully move the backup folder to an external location. If false is returned, BackupAsync throws InvalidOperationException with the relevant message indicating backupCallback returned false. Also, backup will be marked as unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IReliableStateManager#TryGetAsync``1(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to get an of the given type and with the given name.
member.typeparam: When specifying the type, you may ask for either a concrete type or an interface type. The retrieved object will be cast to the given type.
member.param: The name of the . This name must be unique in this across types, including unrelated types.
member.exception: is null.
The instance is not convertible to type .
Exception indicates that the State Manager cannot retrive a reliable collection. can be thrown in all s. For example, when a or looses .
Indicates that the Reliable State Manager is closed.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is a tuple indicating whether the reliable state was found, and if so the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IReliableStateManager#RemoveAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the with the given name from this state manager. The state is permanently removed from persistent storage and all replicas.
member.remarks: This is an atomic operation. The will be successfully removed along with all state or be left in-tact.
member.param: The name of the to remove.
member.exception: is null.
An with the given name does not exist.
The operation failed to complete within the default timeout.
Thrown when the is not in .
Indicates that the Reliable State Manager is closed.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous remove operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IReliableStateManager#RemoveAsync(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Removes the with the given name from this state manager. The state is permanently removed from persistent storage and all replicas.
member.remarks: This is an atomic operation. The will be successfully removed along with all state or be left in-tact.
member.param: The name of the to remove.
The amount of time to wait for the operation to complete before throwing a TimeoutException. Primarily used to prevent deadlocks. The default is 4 seconds.
member.exception: is null.
An with the given name does not exist, or is negative.
The operation failed to complete within the given timeout.
Thrown when the is not in .
Indicates that the Reliable State Manager is closed.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous remove operation.

member.summary: Removes the with the given name from this state manager. The state is permanently removed from persistent storage and all replicas when the transaction is committed.
member.remarks: This is an atomic operation. The will be successfully removed along with all state or be left in-tact. If this method throws an exception, the transaction must be aborted.
member.param: Transaction to associate this operation with.
The name of the to remove.
member.exception: is null, or is null.
An with the given name does not exist.
The operation failed to complete within the default timeout.
Thrown when the is not in .
Thrown when a method call is invalid for the object's current state. Example, transaction used is already terminated: committed or aborted.
Indicates that the Reliable State Manager is closed.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous remove operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IReliableStateManager#GetOrAddAsync``1(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an of the given type and with the given name if it exists, or creates one and returns it if it doesn't already exist.
member.remarks: This is an atomic operation. When an needs to be created, it will either complete and return successfully or it will not be created.
member.typeparam:
When specifying the type, you may ask for either a class type or an interface type.
If specifying a class type, the system will attempt to return an instance of that type. If an instance of that type cannot be instantiated (e.g., abstract class, no suitable constructor), an ArgumentException is thrown.
If specifying an interface type, the manager will attempt to resolve the interface to a concrete type. If type mapping is specified by the user, this method will use the user-specified mapping to resolve the type (not yet supported). If type mapping is not specified by the user this method will select the default implementation for the interface given. If the given interface type does not have a default implementation, or a user-specified mapping for the type is not provided or the type is invalid, this method will throw ArgumentException.
member.param: The name of the . This name must be unique in this across types, including unrelated types.
member.exception: is null.
An instance of the type cannot be created, or the existing instance is not of type .
The operation failed to complete within the default timeout.
Thrown when the is not in .
Indicates that the Reliable State Manager is closed.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is the reliable state instance.

If type mapping is specified by the user, this method will use the user-specified mapping to resolve the type (not yet supported). If type mapping is not specified by the user this method will select the default implementation for the interface given. If the given interface type does not have a default implementation, or a user-specified mapping for the type is not provided or the type is invalid, this method will throw ArgumentException.
member.param: The name of the . This name must be unique in this across types, including unrelated types.
The amount of time to wait for the operation to complete before throwing a TimeoutException. Primarily used to prevent deadlocks. The default is 4 seconds.
member.exception: is null.
An instance of the type cannot be created, or the existing instance is not of type , or is negative.
The operation failed to complete within the given timeout.
Thrown when the is not in .
Indicates that the Reliable State Manager is closed.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is the reliable state instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IReliableStateManager#CreateTransaction
member.summary: Create and start a new transaction that can be used to group operations to be performed atomically.
member.remarks: Operations are added to the transaction by passing the object in to reliable state methods.
member.returns: A new transaction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IReliableStateManager#TryAddStateSerializer``1(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.IStateSerializer{``0})
member.summary: Adds a state serializer. Adds it for all reliable collection instances.
member.typeparam: Type that will be serialized and de-serialized.
member.param: The state serializer to be added.
member.returns: True if the serializer was added. False if a serailizer is already registered.
member.remarks: This method can only be called in InitializeStateSerializers. Instance specific state serializers always take precedence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.RestoreAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Restore a backup taken by or .
member.param: The directory where the replica is to be restored from. This parameter cannot be null, empty or contain just whitespace. UNC paths may also be provided.
member.remarks: A safe backup will be performed, meaning the restore will only be completed if the data to restore is ahead of state of the current replica.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous restore operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.RestoreAsync(System.String,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.RestorePolicy,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Restore a backup taken by or .
member.param: The restore policy.
The directory where the replica is to be restored from. This parameter cannot be null, empty or contain just whitespace. UNC paths may also be provided.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous restore operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.BackupAsync(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.BackupOption,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Func{Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.BackupInfo,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Performs a backup of all reliable state managed by this .
member.param: The type of backup to perform.
The timeout for this operation.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Callback to be called when the backup folder has been created locally and is ready to be moved out of the node.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous backup operation.
member.remarks: Boolean returned by the backupCallback indicate whether the service was able to successfully move the backup folder to an external location. If false is returned, BackupAsync throws InvalidOperationException with the relevant message indicating backupCallback returned false. Also, backup will be marked as unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#Initialize(System.Fabric.StatefulServiceInitializationParameters)
member.summary: Initialize the state provider replica using the service initialization information.
member.remarks: No complex processing should be done during Initialize. Expensive or long-running initialization should be done in OpenAsync.
member.param: Service initialization information such as service name, partition id, replica id, and code package information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#OpenAsync(System.Fabric.ReplicaOpenMode,System.Fabric.IStatefulServicePartition,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Open the state provider replica for use.
member.remarks: Extended state provider initialization tasks can be started at this time.
member.param: Indicates whether this is a new or existing replica.
The partition this replica belongs to.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous open operation. The result contains the replicator responsible for replicating state between other state provider replicas in the partition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#ChangeRoleAsync(System.Fabric.ReplicaRole,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Notify the state provider replica that its role is changing, for example to Primary or Secondary.
member.param: The new replica role, such as primary or secondary.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous change role operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#CloseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gracefully close the state provider replica.
member.remarks: This generally occurs when the replica's code is being upgrade, the replica is being moved due to load balancing, or a transient fault is detected.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous close operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#Abort
member.summary: Forcefully abort the state provider replica.
member.remarks: This generally occurs when a permanent fault is detected on the node, or when Service Fabric cannot reliably manage the replica's lifecycle due to internal failures.

member.summary: Occurs when a transaction changes.
member.exception: Indicates that the Reliable State Manager is closed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.StateManagerChanged

member.exception: Indicates that the Reliable State Manager is closed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.OnDataLossAsync
member.summary: Set this property to receive notification when this suspects data loss.
member.value: Function called as part of suspected data loss processing.

remarks.para: OnDataLossAsync function takes in CancellationToken and needs to return a Task that represents the asynchronous processing of the event. Returning true indicates that the reliable state manager's state has been restored. Returning false indicates that the reliable state manager's state has not been changed.
The passed delegate should monitor the given cancellation token for cancellation requests.
